title: Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine, Bivalent | Official Site
description: See authorized use for Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine, Bivalent (Original and Omicron BA.4/BA.5).
cleaned_text: Important COVID-19 Update On June 15, 2023, the Vaccines and Related Biological Products Advisory Committee (VRBPAC), an advisory committee to the FDA, met and unanimously voted that the current vaccine composition be updated to a monovalent COVID-19 vaccine with an XBB lineage of the Omicron variant. Based on the totality of the evidence, FDA has advised manufacturers to update their current COVID-19 vaccines to monovalent XBB.1.5 composition in preparation for the fall vaccination campaign. This campaign emphasizes the importance of the flu vaccination and getting up-to-date on immunizations for respiratory illnesses, including COVID-19. FDA will continue to monitor the safety and effectiveness of the COVID-19 vaccines and the evolution of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. Find a vaccine appointment near you. Find the answers you're looking for. Tap or click a card to reveal answers. If you think you're experiencing a side effect, contact your healthcare provider immediately or, if severe, call 9-1-1 or go to the nearest hospital.
